jobTitle.title: A Aspiring Full Stack Web Develop

about: I am currently working the nihgt shift full-time at Woolworth under an agency know as GP Retail Operations as an Operations Administrator. Im also currently I am currently studying full-time at Life Choices Coding Academy.

Once upon a time, in the bustling world of high school, I was the merchant with pockets full of cash and dreams set on computers. Life was good until the day reality hit hard.It all began with a seemingly innocent suggestion from the principal: skip school on certain days for exams. Little did I know, those missed days would shatter my dream. When the results came in, those two missing subjects left my matric certificate incomplete, a haunting reminder of missed opportunities.Determined to pursue my passion for computers, I applied to the Life Choices Coding Academy. But my incomplete certificate was a barrier. Honesty led me to disclose the truth, leaving me disappointed and facing the daunting task of completing my certificate, a year-long process.Desperate to make ends meet, unemployed and disheartened, my grandmothers persistent nagging pushed me to seek employment. Months passed with no luck until a mysterious message led me to an agency that found me a job at Woolworths. It wasnt my dream, but it kept me afloat.As an OPS assistant, I observed those working with computers in the office, sparking a desire to move up. I seized the chance for promotion, climbing slowly, learning, and adapting. Attempts to study ICT were thwarted by COVID, and my savings vanished, yet I persisted, continuously learning new skills during my night shifts.Persistence paid off when my extra efforts caught managements attention. The question that changed everything: Would you be interested in working in the office? I leaped at the chance, becoming the youngest and least experienced to hold that position in Woolworths history.But the glamour faded. The office felt like a scapegoat hub, a place to dump blame. Despite success, dissatisfaction brewed. I loved my job but detested the environment and the paycheck. Thats when I decided to reapply to the Life Choices Coding Academy, seeking a path back to my true passion.Now, despite the discontent, I'm still at Woolworths, surrounded by unbearable colleagues and insufficient pay. But being accepted into the coding academy again promises a new chapter, a chance to fulfill my dreams. The certainty of a clearer future keeps me going, knowing that soon, Ill be immersed in what Ive always yearned for, a life with computers.Its been a journey of setbacks, resilience, and unyielding determination. And now, as I step into this new chapter, the hope of finally merging passion and profession lights the way for

His ability to strike a harmonious equilibrium is truly commendable, showcasing a level of dedication and time management that is exemplary.As a developer, Razien's skills are second to none. His work exudes a distinct old school vibe, reflecting a deep understanding of both classic and contemporary technologies. His projects are not merely a demonstration of technical prowess; they are a testament to his creativity and thoughtful approach to problem-solving.Razien's dedication and drive are truly admirable. He approaches every task with a sense of purpose and determination, and his work ethic is nothing short of inspiring. Despite his seemingly carefree spirit, Razien is incredibly focused, ensuring that each project is executed with precision and attention to detail.Beyond his technical abilities, Razien's helpful nature shines through. His genuine desire to help others underscores his character as a great person both professionally and personally.
